result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Hartline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Vocational/educational training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may6 not vote until civil rights are restored.

Comply with Sex Offender registry.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
No good time credit. Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions. Court ordered defendant to serve 150 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation.
*April 21, 2017-To serve 77 days. Straight time. No good time credit. Order for Commitment signed/filed.
**June 19, 2017  To serve 59 days. Straight time. No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert A Hartline in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Comply with Sex Offender registry
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges.
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months years with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 150 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Comply with Sex Offender registry
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervison or successful completion of probation.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

Defendant Robert A Hartline in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert A Hartline in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Ron Dague for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/20/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Robert A Hartline in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Robert A Hartline in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
